thought: nowadays, I feel that insurance policies are way too expensive than before policy. Bazar is too overrated.

content.twitter: ["Insurance premiums up 40% in 3 years. Called my insurer directly last week—got a renewal quote 12% lower than PolicyBazaar showed. Same policy. Same coverage. Different price.", "PolicyBazaar earns commission on every sale. Their 'best recommendations' = whoever pays them the highest cut. You're not the customer. You're the product.", "Anyone else tried calling insurers directly? What'd you find?"]

tweets.text: ["Insurance premiums up 40% in 3 years. Called my insurer directly last week—got a renewal quote 12% lower than PolicyBazaar showed. Same policy. Same coverage. Different price.", "PolicyBazaar earns commission on every sale.
Their 'best recommendations' = whoever pays them the highest cut. You're not the customer. You're the product.", "Anyone else tried calling insurers directly? What'd you find?"]
